citeinfo.origin: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), Coastal Services Center (CSC)
citeinfo.title: Aids to navigation for US waters, including territories, as of July 2012

descript.abstract:
Structures intended to assist a navigator to determine position or safe course, or to warn of dangers or obstructions to navigation. This dataset includes lights, signals, buoys, day beacons, and other aids to navigation.
These data are intended for coastal and ocean use planning. Not for navigation.
descript.purpose: To support coastal and ocean planning and other activities pursuant to the Energy Policy Act, Coastal Zone Management Act, Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act, National Environmental Policy Act, Rivers and Harbors Act and the Submerged Lands Act.

idinfo.useconst: These data are intended for coastal and ocean use planning. Not for navigation.

attracc.attraccr: The attributes in this dataset are believed to be accurate.

dataqual.logic: These data are believed to be logically consistent. Geometry is topologically clean.
dataqual.complete: Spatial and attribute properties are believed to be complete, although attribute information has been simplified. Geometric thresholds from original data are preserved. No tests have been completed for exhaustiveness.

horizpa.horizpar: Maximum scale of intended use is 1:80,000.

srcinfo.srccontr: Comprehensive light list for the US.

procstep.procdesc: 1. Import XML in to Excel (Data > Get External Data > From Other Sources > From XML Data Import) 2. Delete extra worksheets in Excel document and rename worksheet according to XML name (e.g. "v1d01MonthlyChanges"). Save Excel document and name it according to XML title ("v1d01MonthlyChanges"). 3. Select entire sheet and clear all formatting (Home > Editing > Clear > Clear Formats) 4. Select row 1 (column A - AB) and toggle filter off (Home > Editing > Sort & Filter > Filter) 5. Select row 1 (column A - AB) and convert cells to text (select non-empty cells in row A > right-click > Table > Convert to Range) 6. Remove header rows 2 - 14 7. Remove unnecessary columns A - P 8. Remove column "XREF" (column placement varies between district XMLs) 9. Rename header row field names according to Data Dictionary and freeze it 10. Perform steps 1-9 for all districts, before proceeding to subsequent steps 11. Copy content (without field names) from all (eight) worksheets in to a new spreadsheet. Enter fields names in row A. NOTE: Columns may not match up between worksheets. Check that they match up before combining all worksheets in to one parent worksheet. 12. Insert a new (temporary) column 1 as "refId" and enter a series starting at 1 13. Highlight column "latitude", then Home > Editing > Find & Select > Go To Special > Blanks, then set to: =-9999, CTRL Enter. 14. Highlight column "latitude" and sort low to high (Home > Editing > Sort & Filter > Sort A to Z). (If prompted, click "Expand the selection".) 15. Select and delete rows with -9999 entries 16. Highlight column "longitude", then Home > Editing > Find & Select > Go To Special > Blanks, then set to: =-9999, CTRL Enter 17. Highlight column "longitude" and sort low to high (Home > Editing > Sort & Filter > Sort A to Z). (If prompted, click "Expand the selection".) 18. Select and delete rows with -9999 entries 19. Re-sort on column "refId", and re-number 20. In new column use =SUBSTITUTE(K2, CHAR(10), ": ") to remove the line feeds in the Remarks column 21. Convert new Remarks column to text 22. Remove old Remarks field, and place new Remarks field in the position of the former 23. NOTE: when performing any of the "Optional" replacement steps below, choose the "Find All" button first to visually inspect the cell content to be replaced, before clicking the "Replace All" button. 24. OPTIONAL: Search and replace month abbreviations (Jan., Mar., Apr., June., Jul., Aug., Sept., Oct., Nov., Dec., and some with no periods - with full names) in Remarks field (Home > Editing > Find & Select > Replace)... NOTE: ensure certain words read correctly, such as "Remarks" and "Marked", which may be changed to "ReMarchks" and "Marchked", respectively. 25. OPTIONAL: Search and replace ": : " with ": " in Remarks 26. OPTIONAL: Search and replace ; with : in remarks and structureRemarks 27. OPTIONAL: replace period in structureRemark and aidLocation with a blank 28. For aidName, structureRemark, remarks, and aidLocation columns, determine maximum character count. Use =len(column start row) to get character count of row. Use =max(column start row: column end row), to get max character count of column. 29. Adjust the data dictionary to the necessary field lengths for the four columns that character counts were calculated 30. Add new latitude field (set fields as numeric, with 5 significant digits) 31. Add new temporary fields DEG, MIN, and SEC. Use 0,0,3 significant digits (respectively). 32. In new DEG, MIN, and SEC columns, use the MID function to extract new D/M/S values from original latitude field 33. In the new latitude column, use the FIXED function to populate new latitude values 34. In a new column, use the VALUE function to convert values generated from the FIXED function to numerical values 35. Visually compare original and new latitude fields for logic 36. Ensure values in new latitude column are numeric, with 5 significant digits, then copy to original latitude column, overwriting source content in cells. Again, check that values were copied as numeric, with 5 significant digits. 37. Repeat steps 31-37, to generate longitude values 38. Change longitude values to negative 39. Add new field ("aidColor") to use for symbology (to delineate red nuns vs. green cans vs. other AToNs). Sort "structureRemark" field to enter values in "aidColor" field as "red", "green", or "other". 40. Remove any remaining temporary/interim fields (e.g. refId, DEG, MIN, SEC, etc.) 41. Set text fields, ONLY (not Latitude, Longitude, or other numeric fields), to text cells 42. Unfreeze worksheet 43. Create an empty file geodatabase 44. Load the Excel spreadsheet into ArcMap (File > Add Data> Add XY Data) 45. Compare number of records loaded to total number of records in Excel file after the null positions were removed 46. Export the data as a feature class into the empty geodatabase and add the layer to the MXD 47. Set symbology of the layer, based on color schemes outlined by the "aidColor" field 48. Add/remove any unnecessary fields, select the fields that will be visible, and define any field aliases. 49. Develop a layer file containing symbology. Include Layer Name, Description, Credits, and Scale Ranges (if applicable) within the layer file and its source. 50. Acquire, ingest, merge and update metadata from providers (as needed).

distinfo.distliab: These data are intended for coastal and ocean use planning. Not for navigation.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

enttyp.enttypd: Navigational aids, buoys, beacons and stations used by mariners.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: USCG district the AToN is associated with
PA: position approximate, PD: position doubtful, FD: undocumented
Denotes if the aid is for day, night or both uses
Describes the physical appearance of the navigational aid
Additional remarks pertaining to the appearance, behavior, or use of the navigational aid
Description of the navigational aid's location
Unique idenfication number attirbuted to the navigational aid
